holidays.name: Pecan Pie Day
holidays.description: Celebrate one of America’s most delicious desserts, pecan pie! This day honors the sweet, nutty treat often enjoyed during holidays and family gatherings.
holidays.origin: While the exact origin is unclear, pecan pie’s popularity in the southern U.S. dates back to the late 19th century, and this day spotlights that sticky, buttery goodness.
holidays.funFact: The world's largest pecan pie was over 40 feet in diameter and weighed more than a ton!

holidays.name: Paper Bag Day
holidays.description: A quirky nod to the humble paper bag, this day encourages people to appreciate reusable bags and think about environmental conservation.
holidays.origin: Started as an environmental awareness day to reduce plastic bag use and celebrate eco-friendly alternatives.
holidays.funFact: The first paper bag machine was invented in 1852, revolutionizing shopping forever!

holidays.name: Different Colored Eyes Day
holidays.description: A celebration of people born with heterochromia — the rare condition of having two different colored eyes.
holidays.origin: An unofficial observance that brings awareness to this beautiful genetic rarity and encourages people to embrace uniqueness.
holidays.funFact: Famous heterochromic-eyed celebrities include David Bowie and Kate Bosworth!
